metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3605 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in OpenEXR's rleUncompress functionality in versions prior to 3.0.5. An attacker who is able to submit a crafted file to an application linked with OpenEXR could cause an out-of-bounds read. The greatest risk from this flaw is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3605` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
openexr - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openexr package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1').
